text:
- I actually had no idea
what I was getting into.
- Didn't know what a server rack was.

- I thought it was just
gonna be a big room
with a lot of beeping machines.
- I didn't have a data center background.
- No previous technical experience.
- And you don't have to have IT expertise.
- All you need is a high school diploma
and be able to work 40 hours.
I saw it. I applied.

And now, I'm an engineer
operation technician.

- So, when you first start
off the first couple of days,
you are doing online training.
And then from there, you're partnered up
with a tech that already works there
and they're showing you the hands-on job.
- The people who you're working with
are invested in your success.
- AWS a hundred percent invested in me.
- They'll pay for you to go to school.
Theyâ€™ll pay for you to go to school (Amazon Career Choice for hourly Amazonians).

They'll pay for you to
actually get certified.
- For my position, there's a lot of focus

on the infrastructure in
terms of power and cooling.
- I'm more so walking around the building,
maintaining it to make sure
that everything is running properly.

- I'm at the data center for
maybe eight hours of the day
for one day.

The next day, I'm probably
at the corporate office.
- One day I could be doing install,

the next day I could
be dealing with racks.
- Pretty much my day to day is it's on me.
I choose and I create my schedule.
- There's a lot of opportunity here.
The experience that you get here

is going to lead you
places in your career.

- Going from one team
to another within Amazon
is very easy and very simple.
I wanna go into fashion.

I'll reach out to the
fashion hiring managers.

- I'm thinking about
dabbling and getting a degree

in web design and they'll
pay for those classes.

- I went ahead and did the
solutions architect exam
on my own.

- My personal plan is
to land a cloud position
with the cloud support team.

- The opportunities once
you're in AWS are limitless.
- There's so many opportunities out here

that I did not know
about until I joined AWS.
Here, you can go anywhere.
